content:
I do not possess information about the present, but i can provide a general outline of some initiatives london has taken or that could be taken to increase access to public transportation and reduce reliance on personal vehicles:

1. expanding the london underground (also known as the tube), which currently has 11 lines and serves approximately 5 million passengers per day.

2. developing the crossrail project, which is a new high-speed railway that will connect several areas outside of the city with the center.

3. investing in new and existing bus routes to improve services and make bus travel faster and more reliable.

4. encouraging cycling by building more dedicated cycle lanes and providing bike-sharing schemes like santander cycles.

5. introducing congestion charges to discourage people from driving into the city center, and using the revenue generated to fund public transportation improvements.

6. improving accessibility for people with disabilities to public transportation.

7. increasing the availability of electric and hybrid vehicles for public transportation, reducing emissions.

8. encouraging employers to offer flexible work hours or remote working options.

9. increasing awareness of and incentives for carpooling.

10. smart city integration to optimize services, utilization of available routes and timely maintenance of transportation infrastructure.
